artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Ōmiya Kyūjirō
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 166.8; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 287.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: man kneeling on PL knee, with PR leg outstretched to side, holding a gold disc behind his head with both hands; man wears red headband and blue and white armor with black fringe at bottom, with a garment with large blue flowers of red ground tired around his waist; clouds of salmon colored smoke coming from black braiser at left behind man
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Beauty and Bravory in the ‘Tales of the Water Margin’ (Biyū suikoden 美勇水滸伝)
title: Ōshima Tanzō
